bill.title: Cosmetology licensure law; revise certain requirements, prescribe fees and extend repealer.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-7-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "practitioner" For Purposes Of The Cosmetology Licensure Law; To Amend Section 73-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Qualifications For The Issuance Of A Master Practitioner License By The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Amend Section 73-7-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Licensees To Complete Continuing Education In Disinfection/sanitation For License Renewal; To Amend Section 73-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Certain Fines Which May Be Imposed By The State Board Of Cosmetology For Violations Of The Cosmetology Licensure Law; To Amend Section 73-7-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Certain Fees Charged By The State Board Of Cosmetology For Licensure Services; To Amend Section 73-7-63, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The State Board Of Cosmetology; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Welfare
